The character of the economy which has often been revealed in the effort to save up means, is an offense to God. He says, "The silver is Mine and the gold is Mine." Religious and spiritual interests must not be narrowed down and subordinated to the accumulation of means in the conference treasury, that the officers may stand high in the estimation of the people as good financiers. The Lord looks beneath the surface to the outcome, and He does 


                                    -307- 

not approve of such financiering.--Ms 17, 1908. ("The Work in California," February 15, 1908.) 

Released March 17, 1978.
